qas.question: What is one thing that can be used in place of pesticides?
What natural product can be used to control pests?
Why are alternative methods of pest control gaining popularity?
What agency has offered acceptance of safer pesticides?
What is one non chemical way of dealing with pests?
What is recommended by the EPA for cultivating a garden to enrich the soil?
How well do insects breed in your yard when you use a yard waste bin?
How is genetic engineering compared to conventional crop growing methods?
What is one thing that the use of pesticides does when used on insects?
What chemical is secreted by insects when they are breeding?

context: Alternatives to pesticides are available and include <a0_0>methods of cultivation<a0_0/>, use of biological pest controls (such as <b9_0>pheromones<b9_0/> and microbial pesticides), genetic engineering, and methods of <a4_0><b8_0>interfering with insect breeding<b8_0/><a4_0/>. Application of <a1_0><b5_0>composted yard waste<b5_0/><a1_0/> has also been used as a way of controlling pests. These methods are becoming increasingly popular and often are <a2_0><b7_0>safer<b7_0/> than traditional chemical pesticides<a2_0/>. In addition, <a3_0>EPA<a3_0/> is registering reduced-risk conventional pesticides <b6_0>in increasing numbers<b6_0/>.
